After asking in <#C6LV2R5JB|vscode>, this is how LanguageServer.jl seems to auto-complete unicode characters <https://github.com/julia-vscode/LanguageServer.jl/blob/86a173de25b55430d950369bdbe3d82582e27778/src/requests/completions.jl#L69-L76>

It uses REPLCompletions.jl to do that, I think!
For the time being, <https://github.com/occivink/kakoune-snippets> or working on <https://sw.kovidgoyal.net/kitty/#|kitty>, seem to be the best options for this
(Note that kakoune has native kitty support with kitty-repl and send-text, like tmux. Plus kitty supports images in terminals, gpu acceleration and a neat interface for typing unicode characters)

messages.text:
Copy and paste this to your julia.kak file (`/usr/share/kak/rc/filetype/julia.kak` in linux)
<https://raw.githubusercontent.com/clad26/kakoune/patch-1/rc/filetype/julia.kak> to use auto-indent

[February 21st, 2021 11:10 PM] pjentsch: I feel a bit silly asking this, but I'm having a lot of trouble getting kakoune to work. I did all the things in the LanguageServer.jl tutorial but I have no idea how the plugin system is supposed to work. This is the error:
```*** This is the debug buffer, where debug info will be written ***
/home/peterj/.config/kak/kakrc:no such command: 'plug'
/usr/share/kak/kakrc:29:1: 'evaluate-commands' 116:1: 'source' no such command: 'plug'
error while parsing kakrc:
    1:1: 'source' 29:1: 'evaluate-commands' 116:1: 'source' no such command: 'plug'```
attachments.text:

messages.text: No I actually did not get it to work. The julia language server seems to work but not any other plugins. I made a <https://discuss.kakoune.com/t/trouble-getting-plugins-to-work/1602|post> on the kakoune discourse for it.

attachments.title: Trouble getting plugins to work
attachments.text: Very basic question, I am trying to use kak-lsp with LanguageServer.jl, and am getting this error: *** This is the debug buffer, where debug info will be written *** /home/peterj/.config/kak/kakrc:no such command: 'plug' /usr/share/kak/kakrc:29:1: 'evaluate-commands' 116:1: 'source' no such command: 'plug' error while parsing kakrc: 1:1: 'source' 29:1: 'evaluate-commands' 116:1: 'source' no such command: 'plug' I find the kakoune plugin system really confusing so I have no idea what to do ...
attachments.fallback: Kakoune Community Hub: Trouble getting plugins to work

elements.text: No I actually did not get it to work. The julia language server seems to work but not any other plugins. I made a
post
on the kakoune discourse for it.

messages.text: I have dracula colorscheme installed and the highlighting works fine. Where do you open kakoune? Could be that it's related to the color settings <https://github.com/mawww/kakoune/blob/d6b5240bdfcb1a991e60fa3fd531e72cc8263ae9/doc/pages/faq.asciidoc#why-are-colors-misrendered-in-my-kakoune-clients-|https://github.com/mawww/kakoune/blob/d6b5240bdfcb1a991e60fa3fd531e72cc8263ae9/doc/pages/faq.asciidoc#why-are-colors-misren[…]in-my-kakoune-clients->

messages.text: Am I just missing a line in `kakrc` to start it or something?

elements.text: Am I just missing a line in
kakrc
to start it or something?

messages.text: So initially, the LanguageServer will take some time as in all julia executions, because it's literally loading a julia process with some statements as `using LanguageServer, StaticLint, SymbolServer` and finally setting up the server that waits for requests from kakoune. Could you check if in your global environment all of these packages are installed?

elements.text: So initially, the LanguageServer will take some time as in all julia executions, because it's literally loading a julia process with some statements as
using LanguageServer, StaticLint, SymbolServer
and finally setting up the server that waits for requests from kakoune. Could you check if in your global environment all of these packages are installed?

messages.text: Yep that was my issue, I had them installed on 1.6-rc1, but that isn't bound to the `julia` command that kak-lsp calls, which was silly of me. Thanks again!

elements.text: Yep that was my issue, I had them installed on 1.6-rc1, but that isn't bound to the
julia
command that kak-lsp calls, which was silly of me. Thanks again!
